required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cytokine Profile of Conjunctivitis, Performed Through Tears Analysis Among Patients Treated With Dupilumab
clinical_study.official_title: Cytokine Profile of Conjunctivitis, Performed Through Tears Analysis Among Patients Treated With Dupilumab

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the cytokine profile of tears in patients suffering from conjunctivitis versus patients without ocular involvement, when treated with Dupilumab

primary_outcome.description: Change in inflammatory cytokines in tears collected by capillary before and after treatment with Dupilumab. Analysis will be performed by flow cytometry. Concentrations of the following cytokines wil be measured: interleukin-1 β, interleukin-3, interleukin-4, interleukin-5, interleukin-6, interleukin-8, interleukin-10, interleukin-13, interleukin-17, interferon α, Tumor Necrosis Factor α.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the increase of lacrimal inflammatory cytokines between the 2 groups
secondary_outcome.description: Change in inflammatory cytokines in tears collected by capillary among conjunctivitis patients versus non conjunctivitis patients, when treated with Dupilumab. Analysis will be performed by flow cytometry. Concentrations of the following cytokines wil be measured: interleukin-1 β, interleukin-3, interleukin-4, interleukin-5, interleukin-6, interleukin-8, interleukin-10, interleukin-13, interleukin-17, interferon α, Tumor Necrosis Factor α.
Presence of demodex on lashes before treatment with Dupilumab

Improvement of quality of life for patients treated with Dupilumab, assessed with Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire, scored from 0 (normal/no ocular involvement) to 100 (severe ocular disease)

arm_group.description: Patients treated with Dupilumab with conjunctivitis
Patients treated with Dupilumab and showing no signs of ocular involvement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with severe atopic dermatitis resistant to main immunosuppressive drugs
- treated with Dupilumab
- with or without conjunctivitis
- postmenopausal women (since minimum 24 months), surgically sterilized women or women on contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant or breastfeeding women
